questions.explanation:
Tawny Kitaen.

	The role of Debbie Thompson was originally offered to Kelly McGillis.  However, she was fired early on in filming because she wasn't deemed sexy enough for the part.  Tawny Kitaen can also be seen in "Witchboard" and was married to the former Whitesnake lead singer, David Coverdale.

questions.text: "Bachelor Party" was inspired by real-life experiences of the film's writer and producer, Bob Israel.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Bob Israel was inspired to write this film based upon occurences at his own bachelor party.  Information confirming this can be found in the DVD version of the movie.  Other production credits for Bob Israel include "Ace Ventura: Pet Detective" and "Ace Venture: When Nature Calls".

questions.text: What did Rick Gassko's friend, O'Neill do for a living?
questions.explanation:
Photographer.

	O'Neill was the official photographer of the party.  He was responsible for putting Mr. Thompson in several compromising positions with a few hookers.  The character of Jay O'Neill was played by Adrian Zmed.  Adrian Zmed is also known for his work in "Grease 2" and "T.J. Hooker".

questions.text: Which of the following appliances did Cole offer Rick to break-up with Debbie?
questions.explanation:
all of these.

	Debbie's father really liked Cole and wanted her to marry him instead of Rick.  He told Cole to do what he had to in order to get Rick to dump Debbie.  He also offered Rick $10,000, a set of tires, and a brand new set of Sears tools.

questions.text: Who stole Cole's Porsche and turned it into a hot rod?
questions.explanation:
Rudy.

	Rudy was the mechanic who took Cole's car and tricked it out because he was such an annoyance.  No matter what the guys did, Cole kept coming back for more punishment.

questions.text: What was the name of the huge bodyguard who came to the hotel get the girls from the party?
questions.explanation:
Milt.

	Milt was lead to believe that Debbie and her friends were the hookers who came to the hotel for other customers.  Debbie and the girls dressed up like hookers to crash Rick's bachelor party.

questions.text: What was the name of the hotel where Rick's bachelor party took place?
questions.explanation:
The Parkview Hotel.

	It took place in room 1002 at the Parkview Hotel.  Ironically, Mr. Thompson attended an Elkhead Lodge meeting in the same hotel.

questions.text: Which one of the guys was the only one not to have sex at the party?
questions.explanation:
Rick.

	Rick made a promise to Debbie that he would be faithful to her, so even when O'Neill tried to set him up with a former flame he turned her down.

questions.text: Which of the following did not have a role in "Bachelor Party"?
questions.explanation:
Tim Robbins.

	Even though Tim Robbins was not in this movie, he was considered to play the part of Rick Gassko.  Wendie Jo Sperber played Dr. Tina Gassko, Robert Prescott played Cole Whittier, and Michael Dudikoff played the goof ball waiter Ryko.  Others that were considered for the role of Rick Gassko included Jim Carrey, Paul Reiser, and Howie Mandel.

questions.text: What type of animal ended up dead and was abandoned in the elevator?
questions.explanation:
donkey.

	The wild and crazy guys brought in a donkey to the party and he ended up snarfing down a bunch of pills and keeled over.  Of course, not knowing what to do with him they just ditched him in the elevator.  I hope that you enjoyed my quiz!
